MRCH

Korean: 윤마치

Country:

South Korea

Full name:
Yoon Ji-young
Native name:
윤지영
Birthday:
Mar 25, 1996
Age:
29 years old

Introduction

MRCH is a South Korean independent singer-songwriter. She made her debut on August 14, 2019 with the EP "Let's March!".

theonlyscent:
Nov 1, 2024-present
MRCH MUSIC:
Jan 1, 2019-Nov 1, 2024

Fun facts

1
MRCH started her own independent label/agency called "theonlyscent" after she released a song called "The Only Scent" in 2024.
…
2
MRCH finished in 4th place in the final round of the "Indiestance 2024" competition on October 12, 2024.
…
3
MRCH made a second appearance on Mnet's mystery music game show "I Can See Your Voice 5" in episode 13 on April 27, 2018. She performed "Don't Know You" by Heize.
…
4
MRCH was a contestant on Mnet's mystery music game show "I Can See Your Voice 5" in episode 3 on February 16, 2018. She had the nickname "Yonsei University's BoA". She performed "Atlantis Princess" by BoA and "Energetic" by Wanna One. The guest artist of the episode was Wanna One.
…
5
MRCH (as Yoon Jiyoung) was a contestant representing Yonsei University on Channel A's survival show "Vocal Play 2: Campus Music Olympiad". She performed her song "Like a Movie" in the first round during episode 1 on October 5, 2019. The judges were Sweet Sorrow, Kim Hyun Chul, Ailee, and SG Wannabe's Lee Seok Hoon.
…
6
MRCH appeared on episode 11 of KBS "The Seasons: Rainbow of Lee Young Ji" and performed her song "Human Mechanism" on December 6, 2024.
…
7
MRCH performed her songs "Surrender", "Though we have the earth", "Human Mechanism", "Lovers", "Love is a magic" and "Color It" at Dingo Music's "Rising Voice" on March 25, 2025.
…
8
MRCH is co-credited for backing vocals, chorus, or vocal directing on the songs "Poppin' Shakin'" by NiziU, "Bitter Sweet" by TWICE, "Mine" by Chaeryeong (ITZY), "Teddy Bear" & "Destiny" by Kim Sejeong, and "Summer Charm" by Yerin (GFRIEND).
…
9
MRCH helped compose and arrange the song "Talk that Talk" by TWICE. She also helped compose "Celebrate" & "Got The Thrills" by TWICE, "Yet, But" by Yuna (ITZY), and "Moving On" by NMIXX. She wrote the lyrics to "Catch the Stars" and "Rollercoaster" WOOAH.
…
10
MRCH was interviewed by NMIXX's Lily in episode 8 of "Issue Club" on October 9, 2024.
…
